column4: is there a way to migrate my wubi install to a regular dualboot install?
hi Roasted
so you finally changed your mind :P
no, i want to try it out :P
can i convert, or will i need to reinstall ubuntu?
any suggestions?
i was reading about lvpm but i honestly think i'll be better off simply backing up my smb.conf and reinstalling
what do u use smaba for
sharing files with a windows computer
why not just reconfigure it after upgrade?
so i know its right
samba config is fairly straightforward, tick share set permission and thats it
i must have done it the hard way by editing smb.conf
if you have windows, IMO, paragon partition manager, or partition magic would be better than gparted (IMO)
are they free and how are they better?  they will 100% require a reboot, as i'd need to boot into windows :P
no they are not free...
but i'd still need to reboo
yes.... you will need to reboot in order to resize the partition because it is in use
i'd need to reboot because i'd have to boot into windows to use them
yes, obviously... dont use wine for a process like that
or virtualbox
partion magic does all that for u
i will not be using PM
ok
